intro: Ervatamia blumeana, commonly known as the blue vervain, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces spikes of blue to purple flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Ervatamia blumeana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
